backend

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    Acts as a conduit between the backend functionality and everything external to the backend package.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Window(processing.core.PApplet sketch, float x, float y, float w, float h)
      Class Constructor to initialize an ArrayList of DrawSpace objects for storing the slides and set the default parameters for color and dimensions

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window(processing.core.PApplet sketch,
              float x,
              float y,
              float w,
              float h)
        Class Constructor to initialize an ArrayList of DrawSpace objects for storing the slides and set the default parameters for color and dimensions
        Parameters:
        sketch - a reference to a PApplet to allow general functionality of the processing library
        x - a float to represent the initial x starting position (in pixels) of the DrawSpaces
        y - a float to represent the initial y starting position (in pixels) of the DrawSpaces
        w - a float to represent the width (in pixels) of each DrawSpace (slide)
        h - a float to represent the height (in pixels) of each DrawSpace (slide)

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the current slide and all of it's elements to the screen

      • newToolSelection

        public void newToolSelection()
        Clears the line drawn between a point on the canvas and the mouse position when a new tool is selected. Used when there is no desire to complete a shape

      • zoom

        public void zoom(float factor)
        Alter the size of the slide from its center. If any change should decrease the zoom below 0.1%, it is set to 0.1% instead. Slide starts at 100%
        Parameters:
        factor - The amount to change the current zoom (in percentage) from the current zoom amount

      • withinCanvas

        public boolean withinCanvas(float x,
                            float y)
        Determines if the current mouse position is over the slide
        Parameters:
        x - raw X position of the mouse
        y - raw Y position of the mouse
        Returns:
        a boolean designating whether the position lies over the slide

                             float y,
                             float w,
                             float h)
        Creates and draws an ellipse on the current slide
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        w - A float to represent the width (in pixels) of the ellipse
        h - A float to represent the height (in pixels) of the ellipse
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide sucessfully

      • createEllipse

        public boolean createEllipse(float x,
                             float y,
                             float d)
        Creates and draws a circle on the current slide
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        d - A float to represent the diameter (in pixels) of the circle
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide sucessfully

      • createEllipse

        public boolean createEllipse(float x,
                             float y)
        Starts the creation of an ellipse at first mouse click, finalizes the ellipse at the second click. Between the first and second click, the ellipse shape is dynamic, with the edge following the mouse position.
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide successfully

      • createRect

        public boolean createRect(float x,
                          float y,
                          float w,
                          float h)
        Creates and draws an rectangle on the current slide
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        w - A float to represent the width (in pixels) of the rectangle
        h - A float to represent the height (in pixels) of the rectangle
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide successfully

      • createRect

        public boolean createRect(float x,
                          float y,
                          float d)
        Creates and draws a square on the current slide
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        d - A float to represent the diameter (in pixels) of the rectangle
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide successfully

      • createRect

        public boolean createRect(float x,
                          float y)
        Starts the creation of a Rectangle at first mouse click, finalizes the rectangle at the second click. Between the first and second click, the rectangle shape is dynamic, with the bottom right corner following the mouse position.
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide successfully

      • createTextBox

        public boolean createTextBox(float x,
                             float y,
                             java.lang.String str,
                             java.lang.String font,
                             float textSize)
        Creates and draws text to the slide
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        str - The desired text to be displayed
        font - The desired font of the text to be displayed
        textSize - The desired size of the text to be displayed
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide successfully

      • createInteractiveTextBox

        public boolean createInteractiveTextBox(float x,
                                        float y,
                                        float x2,
                                        java.lang.String font,
                                        float textSize)
        Establishes a text box to allow for interactive input from the user onto the slide. Text will wrap around the width of the box.
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        x2 - Set the starting width of the text box
        font - The desired font of the text to be displayed
        textSize - The desired size of the text to be displayed
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide successfully

      • createComment

        public boolean createComment(float x,
                             float y,
                             java.lang.String str,
                             java.lang.String font,
                             float textSize)
        Creates and draws a comment to the slide. Comments can be hidden.
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse
        str - The desired text to be displayed
        font - The desired font of the text to be displayed
        textSize - The desired size of the text to be displayed
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide successfully

      • importImage

        public boolean importImage(float x,
                           float y,
                           java.lang.String filename,
                           java.lang.String extension)
        Imports an image from the users computer into the program and displays it at a specified position
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position (relative to the window) to display image
        y - Raw Y position (relative to the window) to display image
        filename - The name of the image to display
        extension - The image file type (the . is still necessary)
        Returns:
        Whether or not the object was created and added to the slide successfully

        Parameters:

      • resize

        public void resize(float factor)
        Alter the size of each selected object from the relative center of each object. If no object is selected, the slide is zoomed instead
        Parameters:
        factor - The amount to scale the object (in percentage) from the current size

      • toggleGroup

        public void toggleGroup()
        Deprecated. Grouping is not a supported mechanic in slides
        Groups selected objects if not already a group, otherwise ungroups the grouped objects

      • group

        public void group()
        Deprecated. Grouping is not a supported mechanic in slides
        Groups all the currently selected objects, making it so selecting one selects all in the group

      • unGroup

        public void unGroup()
        Deprecated. Grouping is not a supported mechanic in slides
        Splits up all the objects in all the groups currently selected, if any

      • pan

        public void pan(float mouseX,
                float mouseY,
                float pmouseX,
                float pmouseY)
        Shifts all current selected objects the same amount if mouse is over at least one. If no object is selected, the slide is shfited instead.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - Current raw X position of the mouse
        mouseY - Current raw Y position of the mouse
        pmouseX - Previous raw X position of the mouse
        pmouseY - Previous raw Y position of the mouse

      • setFillColor

        public void setFillColor(int r,
                         int g,
                         int b,
                         int a)
        Changes the current fill color of all selected elements and any future elements created
        Parameters:
        r - Represents the red value in color combinations (range between 0 - 255)
        g - Represents the green value in color combinations (range between 0 - 255)
        b - Represents the blue value in color combinations (range between 0 - 255)
        a - Represents the alpha (transparent) value for the color (range between 0 - 255)

        g - Represents the green value in color combinations (range between 0 - 255)
        b - Represents the blue value in color combinations (range between 0 - 255)

      • select

        public void select(float x,
                   float y)
        Select object below current mouse position, allows for multiple objects selected at a time. If a selected object is clicked again, it is unselected. If the slide is clicked, the selection is cleared.
        Parameters:
        x - Raw X position of the mouse
        y - Raw Y position of the mouse

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
        DO A CHANGE HERE SLKFGAPOFGNSDFDFNLKSDF MSDFKLHF SD,FHLSDK *************************************** Remove each object currently selected from being displayed on the slide. Objects are restorable until new object is added to the slide.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the objects were sucessfully removed from the slide and still restorable

      • deleteSelected

        public boolean deleteSelected()
        Deprecated. 
        DO A CHANGE HERE SLKFGAPOFGNSDFDFNLKSDF MSDFKLHF SD,FHLSDK *************************************** Remove each object currently selected from being displayed on the slide. Objects are restorable until new object is added to the slide.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the objects were sucessfully removed from the slide and still restorable
        See Also:
        delete()

      • duplicateSelected

        public void duplicateSelected()
        Deprecated. 
        Create a deep clone of all currently selected objects and display them on the slide, overlaying the originals. Throws error if unsucessful.
        See Also:
        paste()

      • duplicate

        public void duplicate()
        Deprecated. 
        Create a deep clone of all currently selected objects and display them on the slide,overlaying the originals. Throws error if unsucessful.
        See Also:
        paste()

      • deleteLast

        public boolean deleteLast()
        Remove the most recently created object from the slide. This object is restoreable.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the deleted object is restorable

      • restoreLast

        public boolean restoreLast()
        Restore the most recently trashed (deleted) object back onto the slide.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the deleted object was sucessfully restored

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Remove all objects from the slide. Each object is restorable in reverse order from which they were first added.

      • copy

        public boolean copy()
        DO A CHANGE HERE SLKFGAPOFGNSDFDFNLKSDF MSDFKLHF SD,FHLSDK *************************************** All currently selected slides are flagged for deep cloning later. Each new selection flagging overrides and clears the previous flags.
        Returns:
        Whether or not each selected was sucessfully flagged for cloning later

      • cut

        public boolean cut()
        DO A CHANGE HERE SLKFGAPOFGNSDFDFNLKSDF MSDFKLHF SD,FHLSDK *************************************** Combines the functionality of copy and delete
        Returns:
        Whether or not the objects were sucessfully removed from the slide and still restorable
        See Also:
        copy(), delete()

      • paste

        public void paste()
        Create a deep clone of all currently selected objects and display them on the slide, slightly offset from the original objects. Throws error if unsucessful.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(char key,
                       int keyCode)
        Feeds keyboard input into all currently selected interactive textboxes - allows for interactive typing of text. Delete is not yet supported.
        Parameters:
        key - A character representation of the key currently pressed (capital and lower case letters are different, all function keys are the same)
        keyCode - Represents the value of they key currently pressed (capital and lower case letters are the same, all function keys are different)

      • setThickness

        public void setThickness(float size)
        Set the current stroke thickness for drawn objects
        Parameters:
        size - The desired thickness (in pixels)

      • changeThickness

        public void changeThickness(float so)
        Set the current stroke thickness for drawn objects. If any change should decrease the stroke below 1, it is set to 1 instead.
        Parameters:
        so - The amount to change the current thickness (in pixels)

      • freeDraw

        public void freeDraw(float pmousex,
                     float pmousey)
        Draw a connected free form line which follows the mouse position accross the screen. Intended for call during a mouse drag. Call createFreeForm() to render it to the screen and save it to the slide when the mouse is released.
        Parameters:
        pmousex -
        pmouseY -
        See Also:
        createFreeForm(), mouseRelease()

      • createPollyGon

        public void createPollyGon(float pmousex,
                           float pmousey,
                           int numberVertex)
        DO A CHANGE ********************************* Create and display an in-progress pollygon. The verticies of the polygon coorespond to the position of the each mouse click.
        Parameters:
        pmousex - raw X position of the mouse
        pmousey - raw Y position of the mouse
        numberVertex - Number of verticies the polygon will have

      • createCurve

        public void createCurve(float pmousex,
                        float pmousey)
        DO A CHANGE ********************************* Create and display an in-progress curve. The points of the curve coorespond to the position of the each mouse click.
        Parameters:
        pmousex - raw X position of the mouse
        pmousey - raw Y position of the mouse

      • createLine

        public void createLine(float pmouseX,
                       float pmouseY)
        DO A CHANGE ********************************* Create and display an in-progress stragiht line. The start and stop points of the line coorespond to the position two mouse clicks.
        Parameters:
        pmousex - raw X position of the mouse
        pmousey - raw Y position of the mouse
        See Also:
        addCuve

      • createFreeForm

        public void createFreeForm()
        Render the free drawn line to the slide and save it to the slide as one object. Intended for call during mouse release.
        See Also:
        freeDraw(float pmousex, float pmousey), mouseRelease()

      • nextSlide

        public void nextSlide()
        Go to the slide after the current slide, edit mode allows for slide modification

      • previousSlide

        public void previousSlide()
        Go to the slide before the current slide, edit mode allows for slide modification

      • createSlideAt

        public void createSlideAt()
        Creates a new blank slide after the current slide.

      • moveSlideUp

        public void moveSlideUp()
        Alter the order of the slides by swapping the current slide with the one before it.

      • moveSlideDown

        public void moveSlideDown()
        Alter the order of the slides by swapping the current slide with the one after it.

      • deleteSlide

        public void deleteSlide()
        Delete the current slide. This slide is not able to be restored.

      • selectSlide

        public void selectSlide(int index)
        Go to the the specified slide, edit mode allows for slide modification
        Parameters:
        index - The index value (where the slide is located in the order) of the desired slide, values start at 0.

      • present

        public void present()
        Enter presentation mode. Slides cannot be edited in this mode. Display slides to full screen.

      • endPresent

        public void endPresent()
        Exit presentation mode to allow for slide modification (editing). Slides displayed at normal size.

      • getSlideThumbnails

        public java.util.ArrayList<processing.core.PGraphics> getSlideThumbnails()
        Get all currernt slides for use in the slide scroll menu.
        Returns:
        A list of buffered images of all the slides in order

      • exportAs

        public void exportAs(java.lang.String saveName,
                     java.lang.String extension)
        Export the current slide as an image
        Parameters:
        saveName -
        extension -

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Save all slides to a file that can be opened and restored later.
        Parameters:
        filename - The desired name for the file to be saved under
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • open

        public void open(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Open and restore a previous slide project to continue editing.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name for the slide project to be restored
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
